授業目的: The objective of this course is for students to apply and enhance their understanding of marketing and consumer behavior through analysis of marketing-related cases in various settings.
到達目標:
Specific objectives of this course are for students to:
1. Obtain practical learning experience in discussing how marketing theories are applied into practices through case analysis
2. Develop critical thinking towards the existing marketing frameworks in different contexts.
3. Develop skills to synthesize various components of complex marketing problems and offer workable solutions.
4. Enhance analytical and communication skills through preparation of case analysis for class presentation and a written report.
授業方法:
Online format: Simultaneous and Two-way.
The material for the first week including 'case 1' is available at LUNA. Students are required to purchase cases 2-12 (except Case 6) from the Harvard Business School via the link provided at LUNA. Based on the guiding questions for each case (available at LUNA), students are required to prepare the key points of each case for class discussion.
Due to the interactive (and intensive) nature of this course, each student's commitment to '4Ps'- Preparation, Presence, Participation, and Positive attitude) is crucial to ensure a rewarding and enjoyable learning experience.

トピック.授業外学習2:
It is desirable for students to have completed courses in Marketing Management and/or Marketing Strategy or have a basic understanding of marketing before taking this course.
Students are expected to have a thorough reading of each case and draw attention to its key issues before every session. Please note that in discussing each case, there are no right or wrong opinions, only some that are better than others, and these depend on students' understanding of each case and the ability to relate the key issues of each case to marketing theories and practices.
